business.headline: Why is Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warning investors against pre-IPO hype?With IPO buzz at its peak, Nithin Kamath has stepped in to warn investors about the increasing speculation in the unlisted market, where many buyers are chasing inflated pre-IPO valuations.

How do you recover money after credit card fraud? Steps you must knowRecovering money after credit card fraud can feel stressful, but the process is simpler if you act quickly. Knowing the right steps — and your rights, can greatly improve your chances of getting your money back.

India's GDP rises by 8.2% in Q2 despite Trump tariffs, highest in six quartersIndia's 8.2% Q2 GDP print has beaten forecasts despite pressure from US tariffs, with manufacturing and services driving momentum and reaffirming the nation's place as the fastest-growing major economy heading into FY26.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as Dalal Street takes breather after hitting all-time highsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 13.71 points to close at 85,706.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 12.60 points lower at 26,202.95. The broader market also remained subdued, with most major sectoral indices finishing in the red.

Are millennials relying too heavily on SIPs for wealth building?Millennials swear by SIPs for long term investing, but are they mistaking convenience for safety? As market cycles turn unpredictable, is it time to rethink what "safe investing" really means?

From tax deadlines to LPG, pensions: 5 major financial changes starting December 1Before December begins, it's worth noting that several new financial rules will kick in, affecting your bills, savings and even travel plans. Whether it's cooking gas, pension rules or tax filings, here's what to expect as the calendar turns.

Sudeep Pharma shares rise nearly 29% over IPO price. What should investors do?Sudeep Pharma's strong debut has impressed investors, but with valuations now stretched, is this the right moment to book profits or should investors stay put and ride the long-term story?

From GMP to price band: 5 things to know about Meesho IPOThe SoftBank-backed e-commerce platform has set a price band of Rs 105 to Rs 111 per share, valuing the company at nearly Rs 50,100 crore at the upper end.

Will your pension stop after November 30? Check nowThe deadline to submit the annual Life Certificate is almost here, and missing it could put your pension on hold. Pensioners must complete the process by 30 November to avoid any interruption.

New labour codes bring major employee benefits, but what are the big challenges?The new labour codes promise stronger protection and wider benefits for workers, but the real test begins now as businesses brace for higher costs, major restructuring and a challenging transition across sectors.

Why is tax department sending SMS alerts to 25,000 taxpayers about foreign assets?Tax officials examined data received from foreign jurisdictions through the Automatic Exchange of Information (AEOI) system. This international framework allows countries to share details of financial accounts held abroad by their residents.

Meesho IPO opening on December 3: What investors need to knowMeesho IPO is all set to open for subscription, backed by strong GMP cues and rising investor interest, but can the value-commerce giant turn pre-listing hype into sustained market performance? Here is all you need to know.

Is your money lying unclaimed? Here's how Delhi's new campaign help you recover itThe move is part of the Centre's ongoing 'Apki Punji, Apka Adhikar' campaign, which focuses on returning such funds to their rightful owners.

Sudeep Pharma makes strong market debut. Hold or book profit now?A blockbuster debut has rewarded Sudeep Pharma IPO investors. Should you cash out while sentiment is high or hold on for the company's expansion and export growth story?

Sudeep Pharma shares list at 23% premium in strong market debutThe Rs 895-crore issue, which was subscribed an extraordinary 93.71 times between November 21 and 25, opened at Rs 730 on the NSE and Rs 725 on the BSE, against the upper-end IPO price of Rs 593.

GAIL share price tumbles 6%. Here's why the PSU stock is falling todayThe slump in GAIL's share price reflects investor disappointment over a tariff hike that landed far below expectations. With a full review pushed to 2028, the market is recalibrating its outlook on earnings support for the PSU major.
Sensex, Nifty take breather after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 65.92 points at 85,786.30 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 16.65 points to 26,232.20.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath says crypto derivatives need urgent regulationKamath described the current state of crypto derivative exchanges as "a bit like Schrödinger's cat — neither fully regulated nor unregulated."

ITR refund still pending? Here's how to check your status using PANIf your ITR refund for FY24–25 hasn't arrived yet, you're not alone. Many taxpayers are seeing longer delays this year. The good news: you can quickly check your refund status online using just your PAN.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 episode 97: Malti kicks Farrhana, Pranit roasts Tanya and others The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw Malti Chahar kicking Farrhana Bhatt amid an argument. Pranit More hosted his weekly comedy session, in which he roasted Tanya Mittal and others.

Their encounters drew attention both at an event and on social media.

Rajinikanth's emotional speech at IFFI: 50 years in cinema felt like 10-15 years Rajinikanth was recognised for his five decades in the film industry at the 56th International Film Festival of India (IFFI)'s closing ceremony in Goa. In his speech, the actor reflected on his career and expressed gratitude to fans and the industry at large.

Dhurandhar song Gehra Hua out: Arijit Singh adds soul to Ranveer, Sara's romance The makers of 'Dhurandhar' have unveiled the third track from the upcoming film's album. Titled 'Gehra Hua' and sung by Arijit Singh, the romantic number offers audiences a glimpse into Ranveer Singh and Sara Arjun's on-screen bond.

American singer Jon Batiste's Mumbai debut was spellbinding and a little cheeky American singer Jon Batiste made his Mumbai debut with a captivating and playful live show. His cross-cultural performance highlighted a new spirit in India's live music scene.

Her post came days after the couple announced that the ceremony was being put on hold.

Did Ashnoor intentionally hit Tanya in Bigg Boss 19? Here's what actually happened Ashnoor Kaur has reportedly been evicted from Bigg Boss 19 after a tense clash with Tanya Mittal during the Ticket to Finale task. The incident, captured on camera, sparked massive debate online.

Watch Kartik and Ananya's sun-soaked romance in Tu Meri Main Tera title track The title track of actors Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's upcoming film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' has been released. The film is set for theatrical release on December 25.

Rajinikanth poses with family ahead of IFFI 2025 closing ceremony in Goa The family of actor Rajinikanth joined him in Goa for the closing ceremony of the 56th International Film Festival of India on Friday. Victoria review: Sensitive, realistic tale of a woman bound by patriarchal menRelease Date:Fri Nov 28, 2025 Victoria movie review: Directed by Sivaranjini, Victoria starring Meenakshi Jayan, is a beautiful documentation of a day in the life of being Victoria. The film, mostly centred on women, showcases the everyday aspects and struggles of being one.

Arunachali child actor Riyan Mipi praised by CM for The Family Man 3 role Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu praises young actor Riyan Mipi for his role in The Family Man Season 3. This recognition highlights growing opportunities for Northeast actors on national platforms.

The film balances humour and urgency, offering a fresh yet thoughtful continuation of the Disney prequel.

Trump orders Green Card review for 19 countries. Will it hit Indians?After an Afghan national shot two National Guard members near the White House, President Donald Trump directed USCIS to review the Green Cards of residents from 19 "countries of concern". Authorities will now factor in country of origin, even for current holders, when assessing immigration status. Could India be impacted? Here's all you need to know.

Pak under Munir worse than Hitler's regime: Imran Khan's sister issues warningSpeaking to India Today TV, Imran Khan's sister Noreen Niazi went on to call Pakistan under Asim Munir "worse than Hitler's regime" and claimed that they have not heard from her brother for more than three weeks.

New Afghan equation: India gifts lifesaving drugs, Pak airstrike deathsIndia is winning goodwill in Afghanistan through humanitarian aid and a multi-million-dollar medicine deal, even as Pakistan's airstrikes are killing dozens of Afghans. On Friday, a 73-tonne consignment of lifesaving medicines and vaccines reached Kabul from India. It is a new equation that is emerging amid strained ties with Pakistan, the Afghan Taliban's former ally.

Trump cancels Biden-era orders, claims autopen signatures make them invalidPresident Donald Trump announced he is cancelling all Biden-era executive orders he claims were signed using an autopen, arguing they are invalid. The White House has not responded to his assertions.

Live: Schools closed in Puducherry as cyclone Ditwah nearsCyclone Ditwah Live Updates: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said Cyclonic Storm Ditwah is moving toward the coasts of Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and southern Andhra Pradesh and is expected to make landfall on November 30. The storm originated over the southwest Bay of Bengal near Pottuvil in Sri Lanka and is moving north-northwest. Ditwah made landfall early Friday morning on Sri Lanka's eastern coast and moved northwest toward India, causing widespread damage and killing 56 people in Sri Lanka. It is currently classified as a cyclonic storm, with no forecast of intensifying into a severe cyclone. Tamil Nadu has issued a red alert for four districts and an orange alert for five districts in preparation for the storm. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Ex-PM Khaleda Zia very critical, pray, says BNP with Bangladesh in crucial phaseFormer Bangladesh Prime Minister and BNP chairperson Khaleda Zia has been admitted to a hospital's CCU, with party leaders saying her condition is "very critical". Zia's hospitalisation, after developing infections in her heart and lungs, comes at a time when Bangladesh is inching toward elections early next year, with the BNP being seen as a frontrunner.

Why wasn't Sindh, like Bengal and Punjab, partitioned between India and Pak?Unlike Punjab or Bengal, where the Partition in 1947 gave parts to India and Pakistan, Sindh went completely to the Islamic nation. Its rivers, cities, and centuries of shared culture left behind and uprooted Sindhi Hindus from their homeland. Why isn't any part of Sindh, which finds mention in India's National Anthem, in India?

A 77-foot milestone: PM Modi unveils world's tallest Lord Ram statue in GoaPrime Minister Modi, while addressing a gathering in Goa during the unveiling ceremony, said that just days after he unfurled a sacred flag atop Ayodhya's Ram Mandir, it was a matter of immense happiness for him to have the opportunity to unveil the world's tallest Lord Ram statue.

sports.headline: India thrash Chile 7-0 to open Junior Hockey World Cup campaign in style Rosan Khujur and Dilraj Singh starred as India began their Junior Hockey World Cup campaign in dominant fashion, thrashing Chile 7-0 to underline their title ambitions in front of the home crowd.

He emphasised that good cricket would be key against a confident South African team.

We will fight on: Liverpool manager Arne Slot vows to turn around slump in formLiverpool manager Arne Slot has said that his side will continue to fight on despite their poor run of form in recent times. Liverpool find themselves away from challenging for the title following their recent run.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
